Articles.Content:
I bought KSP in November 2013 and I've been lurking on the forums since then. I've experimented with Realism Overhaul, and I have developed a somewhat unhealthy dependency on MechJeb (especially for docking). ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I did a school project involving KSP a few months ago, and I think some people in this community might find it interesting. What's the best way to share a Power Point and a couple word documents so everybody who wants to can read them?

Also, while I can get to orbit in 1.0.2 manually, I'm neither fuel-efficient at it nor consistent with my gravity turn profiles. Has anybody figured out the best beginner ascent profile for 1.0.2 yet? Something to replace the "go straight up to 8 km and pitch to 45Ã‚Â°" (though I'm guessing the newer version will be somewhat more complicated)?

Also, I like Ike (like, I really like Ike)! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

It's the moon of the hour! 

Welcome to the forum. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Welcome! Have you tried google docs? You could also upload them to mediafire.

I like Ike too!
